oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1952-08-02 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 2, 1952. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer), guest performer Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, the Old Hickory Singers, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that Little Jimmy Dickens will be the guest the following week.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys; Stringbean; Red Foley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Red Foley introduces the Old Hickory Singers) -- Tuck Me To Sleep In My Old 'Tucky Home (Old Hickory Singers) -- Red Foley introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Hank Thompson -- Waiting In The Lobby Of Your Heart (Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys) -- Red Foley introduces Stringbean -- Fireball Mail (Stringbean) -- Red Foley talks -- (The Angels Are Lighting) God's Little Candles (Red Foley) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Red Foley) -- Announcer closing statement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Jordanaires (Musical group); Foley, Red, 1910-1968
